posts.post_content:
Wonderful for tokens. I can already see ![Green or White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=GW&type=symbol) tokens making a comeback ([wolves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=245250), [spirits](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=221214), [myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=206347), [golems](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=233068), [Parallel Lives](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Parallel Lives)...). But outside of mass creature decks, I'd be hesitant to use the ability. ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol) (with the ![Tap](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=tap&type=symbol)) seems a bit much unless you are getting 3+ counters or have nothing better to do with your mana. I'd put this right in the middle for usefulness out of this cycle.  
  
For anyone that wants to see the whole cycle:  
[Gavony Township](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gavony Township)  
[Kessig Wolf Run](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kessig Wolf Run)  
[Moorland Haunt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Moorland Haunt)  
[Nephalia Drownyard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nephalia Drownyard)  
[Stensia Bloodhall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stensia Bloodhall)

Posted By: Doaj (4/29/2012 12:15:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Kessig Infect is at the spotlight right now, and until [Inkmoth Nexus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inkmoth Nexus) rotates out, it's hard to say which land is better. In limited, both [Kessig Wolf Run](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kessig Wolf Run) and Gavony are beasts, [Moorland Haunt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Moorland Haunt) is useful, if you can fuel it, and [Nephalia Drownyard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nephalia Drownyard) is good in the environment, but not so great outside it. The Bloodhall is probably the worst land right now, not useless, just overcosted. I don't think making it 2RB would break the game, or make it creature or player, as a 6 cost to use it doesn't make it so great a menace, specially since most standard decks are already expecting [Shock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shock). All in all, it's a great cycle, and better than seeing yet another set of dual allied lands.
posts.html:
Kessig Infect is at the spotlight right now, and until Inkmoth Nexus rotates out, it's hard to say which land is better. In limited, both Kessig Wolf Run and Gavony are beasts, Moorland Haunt is useful, if you can fuel it, and Nephalia Drownyard is good in the environment, but not so great outside it. The Bloodhall is probably the worst land right now, not useless, just overcosted. I don't think making it 2RB would break the game, or make it creature or player, as a 6 cost to use it doesn't make it so great a menace, specially since most standard decks are already expecting Shock. All in all, it's a great cycle, and better than seeing yet another set of dual allied lands.
